latex:
Let $ a,b,$ and $ c$ be digits with $ a\ne0.$ The three-digit integer $ abc$ lies one third of the way from the square of a positive integer to the square of the next larger integer. The integer $ acb$ lies two thirds of the way between the same two squares. What is $ a + b + c$?\\
\\
$ \textbf{(A)}\ 10 \qquad \textbf{(B)}\ 13 \qquad \textbf{(C)}\ 16 \qquad \textbf{(D)}\ 18 \qquad \textbf{(E)}\ 21$
